titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْمُحْرِمَ لَا يَرْتَمِسُ فِي الْمَاءِ
titles.en: Chapter 91 – The one in Ihraam cannot immerse himself into the water

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/307)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يَرْتَمِسُ الْمُحْرِمُ فِي الْمَاءِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Hareyz, from the one who informed him,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘The one in Ihraam cannot immerse himself into the water’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from Hammad ibn ‘Isa from Hariz from those whom narrated to him who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘One in the state of Ihram must not submerge his head in the water.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/307)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ يَعْقُوبَ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يَرْتَمِسُ الْمُحْرِمُ فِي الْمَاءِ وَ لَا الصَّائِمُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Safwan, from Yaqoub Bin Shuayb,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘Neither the one in Ihraam nor the Fasting one can immerse himself into the water’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Safwan from Ya’qub ibn Shu’ayb who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘One in the state of Ihram must not submerge his head in the water, as well as one fasting.’”
